comments:
GMF RC5. This may be related/moved to EMF.

I've noticed the following :
- Once I generated the genmodel from an ecore file, the genmodel (the XML file) is not updated with additions to the ecore. The genmodel editor (i.e. the tree editor) reflects the change but not the XML file.
- This doesn't cause any problem with the Java code generation but the generation of gmfgen cannot find the added elements in the genmodel file ! This ended with an internal error and a look in the .log file indicates that the added elements cannot be found.

So :
- the genmodel should be updated each time the ecore file is modified => EMF team. Note that there is no easy way to update the genmodel. The only solution is to delete the file and to generate a new one.
- or the gmfgen generation should handle gracefully this situation like the EMF Java code generation.

I spent a lot of time before understanding the cause of this gmfgen problem.

Using "Reload" from .genmodel's context menu generally helps. There's definitely no need to delete .genmodel file.
We do perform .genmodel refresh on .gmfgen creation. Perhaps, we could refresh it additionally prior to code generation.

Thanks for the "Reload" tip but it doesn't work in my case (See below the .log).
So I had to delete the genmodel and regenerate it.

Regarding the refresh of genmodel during the gmfgen, may be it is done and may be an exception is thrown like the one below, thus the refresh is not actually done.

 :

Created an attachment (id=45378)
The different versions of the ecore file showing the reload problem. 

The archive contains the initial ecore file and the updated ecore file. The reload of genmodel for the update throws an exception.
ns prefix and ns uri are essential properties of EPackage. Don't leave them empty.
Following "EMF way" helps to avoid some issues
